a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of primary energy that is low-carbon vs. GDP per capita, 2022
Low-carbon energy is the sum of nuclear and renewable sources, and is measured as a percentage of primary
energy consumption using the substitution method. Gross domestic product (GDP) is adjusted for inflation and
differences in the cost of living between countries.
Share of energy from low-carbon sources
Data source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2024); World Bank (2023)
Note: GDP data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices.
